applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a scheme rules document that outlines the terms, conditions, and operational details of a pension life cover scheme - it is not an advertisement. 2) The document is a legal/contractual document meant to govern the operation of the pension scheme rather than promote or advertise financial services to consumers. 3) While the document contains definitions, rules, and important information, it serves as reference documentation rather than promotional material. The regulation specifically addresses requirements for advertisements of financial services, including how benefits and risks must be presented in advertising materials. Since this document is not advertising material but rather a comprehensive rulebook for scheme operation, the advertising-specific requirements in Regulation 80 are not applicable. The document appears to be subject to different regulatory requirements related to pension scheme documentation and disclosure, but not advertising regulations.
regulation_title: Requirements relating to key information, advertising benefits, and use of small print and footnotes
regulation_text: 80. A regulated entity shall ensure each of the following in respect of information provided by way of advertisement: (a) key information, in relation to an advertised financial service, is clearly identified in the advertisement and is not obscured or disguised in any way by the content, design or format of the advertisement; (b) where more than one advertised financial service is specified in the advertisement, the key information referred to in paragraph (a) is distinguished between each such advertised financial service; (c) if the benefits of an advertised financial service are specified in the advertisement, the risks attached to the advertised financial service are also specified and, where those risks are specified in writing, in a font size that is at least equal to t he predominant font size used throughout the advertisement; (d) information in the advertisement is specified without small print or footnotes unless the small print or footnotes are only used to supplement or elaborate on the key information in the advertisement and are of sufficient size and prominence to be clearly legible.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
